CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1945, pg. 23, reads: "Corp. Jimmie Bragg, who was with the first American troops in New Guinea, was home for thirty...recently. he is the son of Mrs. Lucille Bragg ...039 Kedron Street.  Pictured in family party ...are, left to right: Lee Jobe, Carol Jean Nelson, Yvonne and Rufus Jobe, Mrs. Attie Brown, Mrs. Carl M. Nelson, Corp. Jimmie Bragg and Cephas Bragg.  Standing, left to right; Dorothy Meadows, Mrs. Laura Jobe, James Rose Jr., Mrs. Lene Rose, Stella Roberson, Atchly Berry, Mrs. Lucille Bragg, Jean Rose, Buddy Fain, Evelyn Rose, Mrs. Francis Berry, Mary J. Fain and Edna Bragg. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Bragg family, from left: Lee Jobe, Carol Jean Nelson, Yvonne and Rufus Jobe, Attie Brown, Mrs. Carl M. Nelson, Jimmie Bragg, and Cephas Bragg; standing: Dorothy Meadows, Laura Jobe, James Rose Jr., Lene Rose, Stella Roberson, Atchly Berry, Lucille Bragg, Jean Rose, Buddy Fain, Evelyn Rose, Francis Berry, Mary J. Fain, and Edna Bragg, posed in home of Lucille Bragg, Kedron Street
